section.title: Parameter sweep
section.para: SED-ML level 1 version 2 introduced the concept of repeated tasks, making the description of parameter sweep experiments easier.

section.title: Vector of values
section.para: Parameter sweep are parameterized using range of values; in this first example, a simple vector is used:

listitem.para: In the workflow.xml file from the Changing initial values chapter, add the following node in the listOfTasks block:
listitem.programlisting: <repeatedTask id="task_2" resetModel="false" range="current"> <listOfRanges> <vectorRange id="current"> <value>0.112</value> <value>0.162</value> <value>0.262</value> <value>0.312</value> </vectorRange> </listOfRanges> <listOfChanges> <setValue target="/sbml:sbml/sbml:model[@id='FEBS']/sbml:listOfParameters/sbml:parameter[@id='k3']/@value" range="current" modelReference="febs_model"> <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <ci> current </ci> </math> </setValue> </listOfChanges> <listOfSubTasks> <subTask order="1" task="task_1" /> </listOfSubTasks> </repeatedTask>
listitem.para: This repeatedTask iteratively changes the value of k3 in the target model and execute the simulation encoded in task_1. k3 will take all the values listed in the vectorRange named current. Note the use of a MathML block in the setValue node; mathematical constructs (similar to the ones used in computeChange nodes) can be defined here.

section.title: Functional ranges
section.para: Parameter sweep can be parameterized using more sophisticated ranges:

listitem.para: Replace the repeatedTask node written in the previous paragraph by the following node:
listitem.programlisting: <repeatedTask id="task_2" resetModel="false" range="shift"> <listOfRanges> <uniformRange id="shift" start="0.0" end="0.5" numberOfPoints="4" type="linear" /> <functionalRange id="current" range="shift"> <listOfVariables> <variable id="k3" name="p_k3" modelReference="febs_model" target="/sbml:sbml/sbml:model[@id='FEBS']/sbml:listOfParameters/sbml:parameter[@id='k3']/@value"/> </listOfVariables> <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <apply> <plus/> <ci> shift </ci> <ci> k3 </ci> </apply> </math> </functionalRange> </listOfRanges> <listOfChanges> <setValue target="/sbml:sbml/sbml:model[@id='FEBS']/sbml:listOfParameters/sbml:parameter[@id='k3']/@value" range="current" modelReference="febs_model"> <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <ci> current </ci> </math> </setValue> </listOfChanges> <listOfSubTasks> <subTask order="1" task="task_1" /> </listOfSubTasks> </repeatedTask>
listitem.para:
This repeatedTask, like the previous one, iteratively run the task identified as task_1; it uses two ranges to compute the values of k3:
A linear uniformRange taking four values between 0 and 0.5
A functionalRange using the values returned by the previous uniformRange to apply a shift to the value of k3, meaning task_1 will be iteratively executed with k3 being equal to k3, k3+0.125, k3+0.25, etc.
